title: UN says Syria agrees to open 2 new crossings for quake aid
description: The United Nations says Syria’s president has agreed to open two new crossing points from Turkey to the country’s rebel-held northwest to deliver desperately needed aid and equipment for millions of earthquake victims

title: Brazilian police arrest teenager in thwarted school attack
description: Police in Brazil arrested a teenager accused of trying to attack a school with explosives while wearing a Nazi armband Monday in a small city outside Sao Paulo

title: US criticizes Israeli settlement plans but offers no action
description: The United States has criticized new Israeli plans to build thousands of new homes for Jewish settlers in the occupied West Bank

title: Moldova again at center of tug between Moscow and the West
description: The country of Moldova, which is sandwiched between Ukraine and Romania, has often been at the center of a struggle between Moscow and the West

title: Russia delays launch to space station while leak is probed
description: Russia will postpone the launch of an empty space capsule to the International Space Station pending further investigation of a coolant leak on a supply ship docked to the station

title: Colombian government, rebels resume peace talks in Mexico
description: Colombia’s government and its largest remaining rebel group have met in Mexico City to resume peace talks

title: WHO says Equatorial Guinea confirms 1st outbreak of Marburg
description: The World Health Organization says Equatorial Guinea has confirmed its first-ever outbreak of Marburg disease, saying the Ebola-related virus is responsible for at least nine deaths in the tiny Western African country

title: Newborn saved from rubble in quake-hit Syria in good health
description: The baby girl born under the rubble of her family’s home in northern Syria in the aftermath of last week’s devastating earthquake is in good health and being breast-fed by the wife of the director of the hospital where she is being cared for, her doctor says

title: UK queen consort tests positive for COVID-19
description: Buckingham Palace says Camilla, Britain’s queen consort, has tested positive for Covid-19 after suffering from cold symptoms

title: Hungary FM's Belarus visit 1st from EU country since 2020
description: Hungarian Foreign Minister Peter Szijjarto has made the first visit to Belarus by a high-level politician from a European Union country since Belarus imposed a harsh crackdown on opposition in 2020

title: A week after the quakes, many survivors in Turkey and Syria are still waiting for aid
description: The death toll surpassed 36,000 Monday, and calls for justice for the victims grew louder, particularly in Syria, where hardly any aid arrived in the days after the disaster.

title: Berlusconi blames Ukraine war on Zelenskyy, chafes Meloni
description: Italian former Premier Silvio Berlusconi has once again put himself at odds with current Premier Giorgia Meloni by openly criticizing her for meeting with Ukraine’s leader, whom he blamed for the nearly year-old Russian invasion

title: Blast from gas leak in Ottawa suburb seriously injures two
description: A blast caused by a gas leak has seriously injured two people and destroyed several homes under construction in an Ottawa suburb

title: German ballet director suspended after feces attack
description: A German newspaper critic had animal feces smeared on her face by a ballet director in the city of Hannover after he apparently took offense at a review she wrote

title: After their genitals were cut, some women search for healing
description: A global target aims to eradicate the deeply entrenched practice of female genital cutting by 2030

title: Turkey earthquake survivors face despair, as rescues wane
description: Thousands left homeless by a massive earthquake that struck Turkey and Syria a week ago packed into crowded tents or lined up in the streets for hot meals

title: France says its troops misrepresented in 'Wakanda Forever'
description: France’s defense minister has denounced the way he says French soldiers deployed in Africa appear to be depicted in the Marvel Studios superhero film “Black Panther: Wakanda Forever” as “false and misleading.”

title: German party moves to expel former spy chief as member
description: Germany’s main opposition party has launched an effort to expel from its ranks a former head of the country’s intelligence agency, weeks after he complained of what he said was a move toward “eliminatory racism against whites.”

title: Norway official who spied for the Soviets has died in Moscow
description: Arne Treholt, the former Norwegian Foreign Ministry official who was convicted of spying for the Soviet Union in what became Norway’s biggest Cold War espionage scandal has died in his Moscow home

title: War for control of Haiti's capital targets women's bodies
description: Haiti’s toxic slate of gangs are plundering the Caribbean nation

title: Norway: Russia is a threat for all of Europe
description: Norway’s intelligence serivce says Russia is the main security threat for Norway and Europe

title: Berlusconi blames Ukraine war on Zelenskyy, chafes Meloni
description: Former Premier Silvio Berlusconi has once again put himself at odds with Premier Giorgia Meloni by openly criticizing her for meeting with Ukraine’s leader, whom he blamed for the year-old Russian invasion

title: Photos: Search continues for earthquake survivors in Syria and Turkey
description: The desperate search for survivors continues in the ruins of buildings flattened by last week's powerful earthquakes in Turkey and Syria.

title: Rights group questions Lockerbie suspect’s extradition
description: A leading rights group urged the U.S. and Libya Monday to clarify the legality of a surprise extradition of a suspect in the 1988 bombing of Pan Am Flight 103 over Lockerbie, Scotland

title: Moldova's President outlines Russian 'plan' to topple gov't
description: Moldova’s President has outlined what she says is Moscow’s plans to overthrow Moldova’s government, and involves the use of external saboteurs that would ultimately “put our country at the disposal of Russia” and throw it off course to one day join the European Union

title: Russia pushes advance on Bakhmut, bolsters defenses in south
description: Ukraine’s presidential office says fierce battles are raging outside Bahkhut as Russian forces are pushing their advance on the eastern city with heavy shelling and infantry attacks

title: China says at least 10 U.S. balloons have flown over its airspace since 2022
description: Following allegations of Chinese spy balloons over the Americas, Beijing said that it was “common” for U.S. high-altitude balloons to fly into other countries’ airspace.

title: Nuclear-armed Pakistan reaches for IMF loan to avoid default
description: Officials and analysts say nuclear-armed and cash-strapped Pakistan will impose billions in new taxes to court a massive bailout, but they warned the move could cause inflation to escalate

title: Portugal church sex abuse study finds 512 alleged victims
description: A committee that has been examining historic child sex abuse in Portuguese Catholic Church says 512 alleged victims have come forward

title: UK to review security after unknown objects puzzle N America
description: Britain has announced a security review after several unidentified objects were shot down in the skies over North America

title: Australian inquiry asks whether mom smothered her 4 children
description: A retired Australian judge investigating the convictions of a mother in the deaths of her four children has been told there is a “reasonable hypothesis” that could cast doubt on her guilt

title: Thousands march in Israel as Netanyahu allies push overhaul
description: Thousands of Israelis are protesting outside the country’s parliament building ahead of a preliminary vote on a bill that would give politicians greater power over appointing judges

title: Turkey-Syria quake live briefing: Turkish airport reopens to aid shipments; death toll exceeds 34,000
description: An airport in a hard-struck part of Turkey reopened for aid deliveries on Sunday, but help is still slow to reach parts of Syria.

title: Pakistan nabs 50 men in weekend killing of blasphemy suspect
description: Officials say Pakistan’s police have arrested at least 50 suspects in a mob lynching of a man already detained on charges of blasphemy

title: As survival window closes, more rescued in quake in Turkey
description: Rescue crews on Monday pulled a 40-year-old woman from the wreckage of a building a week after two powerful earthquakes struck, but reports of rescues are coming less often as the time since the quake reaches the limits of the human body’s ability to survive without water, especially in sub-freezing temperatures

title: Protesters descend on Jerusalem as Knesset takes up Netanyahu’s judicial overhaul
description: Thousands of Israelis are expected to go on strike Monday and protest outside parliament in what they say is a final push to stop Minister Benjamin Netanyahu from overhauling the country’s judicial system.

title: Ukraine live briefing: Defense ministers set to meet in Brussels as Kyiv continues appeal for fighter jets
description: Kyiv-allied defense ministers meet in Europe this week ahead of the one-year anniversary of Russia’s invasion on Feb. 24.

title: Iran releases filmmaker held for 6 months over criticism
description: A pro-reform newspaper says Iran has relased an award-winning filmmaker more than six months after arresting him for criticizing the government

title: Russians abandon wartime Russia in historic exodus
description: Since Russia invaded Ukraine, hundreds of thousands have left, including many men who don't want to fight. Some emigres oppose the war, others were driven by economic self-interest.

title: War in Ukraine was geopolitical ice bucket in our face, diplomat says
description: Austrian Foreign Minister Alexander Schallengerg speaks with Today’s WorldView about his nation’s geopolitical position, the war in Ukraine and its impact on European politics.
